Crimes.Crime_Name: Residency requirement non-compliance under Citizenship Act
Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge erred in determining residency eligibility under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Procedural_Stage: Appeal under subsection 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Assessment: Travel stamps, tax records, banking transactions, addresses
Legal_Rule: Applicants must meet one of three criteria: (i) physical presence for three years, (ii) maintaining strong ties while temporarily absent, or (iii) centralizing mode of existence in Canada
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness – implied as judicial review by Federal Court
Procedural_Issue: Respondents were absent due to service issues
Review_Standard: Assessment of legal error and adequacy of reasoning
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Lack of clarity and logical calculation in original decision raises fairness concerns
Key_Evidence_Considered: Travel stamps, tax records, bank transactions, addresses
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged the judge's determination of residency compliance
Court_Result: Case referred back to a different citizenship judge
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence: travel, tax, banking, address records
Remedy_Sought: Reassessment by a new citizenship judge
Applicable_Process: Citizenship appeal process under Citizenship Act

Crimes.Crime_Name: False or misleading information in citizenship application
Dispute_Type: Allegation of false or misleading information in citizenship application
Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge failed to adequately reason the decision on physical presence
Procedural_Context: Appeal under subsection 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Credibility_Assessment: Applicants showed contradictions and implausibilities in records
Evidence_Type: Travel stamps, tax records, banking transactions, work/school records, shared addresses
Basis_of_Claim: False or misleading information affecting residency claims
Evaluation_Standard: Clear and logical reasoning required from judge
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Contradictions in documentation and lack of clear reasoning by judge
Application_Error: Judge referenced trip outside reference period; blended residency tests incorrectly
Assessment_Standard: Proper application of one of three residency tests without blending
Evidence_Ignored: No explicit mention, but inconsistencies noted
Legal_Standard: Judges must apply one method for assessing residency, not blend them
Application_Factor: Physical presence, strong ties, or centralization of mode of existence
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in legal reasoning regarding residency
Outcome_of_Review: Case remanded to new citizenship judge
Evidentiary_Issues: Missing stamps, tax discrepancies, limited banking activity
Document_Fraud: Implied through false or misleading information allegations
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicants challenged sufficiency of judge’s reasoning
Procedural_Issue: Service issues leading to respondents’ absence
Omission_Type: Failure to account for relevant periods or evidence accurately
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Providing false or misleading information in application
